fields.question_text: In general, classes are like what for creating an object?
fields.question_display: In general, classes are like what for creating an object?
fields.answer_value: Classes act as a blueprint for creating objects.

fields.question_text: What is the main purpose of the __init__() method on a class?
fields.question_display: What is the main purpose of the __init__() method on a class?
fields.answer_value: It initializes each new instance of a class.
A class is instantiated to create an object from its design and contains real data.
Instance attributes are created by the __init__() and its values are specific to a particular instance of a class.
A class attribute provides the same value for all instances of that class.

fields.question_text: Which is the instance attribute and which is the class attribute? class Dog: species = 'Canis familiaris' def __init__(self, name, age): self.name = name self.age = age
fields.question_display: Which is the instance attribute and which is the class attribute?
fields.answer_value: Species is the class attribute and name and age are instance attributes.

fields.question_text: Instantiate the following class -- class Dog: species = 'Canis familiaris' def __init__(self, name, age): self.name = name self.age = age
